alert.note: Alert for Custer (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 12:31AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Custer County through 115 AM CDT... At 1230 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Oconto, or 23 miles southwest of Broken Bow, moving east-southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oconto, Buckeye, Block Hill Basin, Pressey State Wildlife Management Area, Burr Oak, Lodi, Intersection of Highway 183 and Cumro Road and Cumro. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 73 and 84. Highway 2 between mile markers 306 and 307. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
